Description.val:
Consolidated Afloat Networks and Enterprise Services (CANES) is the Navy's Program of Record (POR) to replace and modernize existing afloat networks with a cyber-hardened, warfighting resilient hardware, software and enterprise services infrastructure to enable information warfare from and within the tactical domain to expand the Fleets digital competitive advantage. CANES provides complete network infrastructure including hardware, software, processing, storage, and end user devices for the Unclassified, Coalition, Secret and Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) enclaves to a wide variety of Navy surface combatants, submarines, Maritime Operations Centers, and Aegis Ashore sites. CANES services include application hosting, data transport and storage, system management, cyber security, email, web, chat, collaboration, and voice and video services. CANES is designed using commercial sector industry best practices of reducing the number of separate Fleet networks and drives affordability with a single engineered technical solution across the Fleet from patrol craft to aircraft carriers. As much as possible, CANES relies on Commercial Off-The-Shelf (COTS) hardware and software to reduce development time and cost, and leverages commercial Information Technology (IT) approaches to include Development, Security, and Operations (DevSecOps) to drive rapid upgrades. It allows for streamlined acquisition, contracting, sustainment, and significant lifecycle efficiencies through consolidation of multiple configuration management baselines, logistics, and training efforts into a single unified support structure.

The CANES Application Integration effort provides common software governance, testing, processes, and tools to application developers, and conducts integration testing to confirm compatibility for hosted applications prior to fielding. More than eighty (80) hosted software applications and systems - including Command and Control, Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance, Information Operations, Logistics, and Business domains - require the CANES infrastructure to operate in the tactical environment. Specific programs, such as Distributed Common Ground System - Navy (DCGS-N), Global Command and Control System - Maritime (GCCS-M), Naval Tactical Command Support System (NTCSS), and Undersea Warfare Decision Support System (USW-DSS), no longer provide their own independent network hardware and now depend on CANES to field, host, and sustain their capabilities. CANES also provides a set of capabilities called Agile Core Services (ACS) which brings advanced data science capabilities and other common network services to allow hosted application developers to focus on the unique capabilities they provide.

CANES is funded and programmed to field regular technical updates in order to keep pace with rapidly evolving cyber security threats and meet emerging operational demands. CANES uses a DevSecOps framework to improve its engineering processes and speed the deployment of new cyber security, application hosting and technical updates. Future CANES systems will incorporate technologies such as Cloud computing, Machine learning, and Artificial Intelligence.

CANES is a mature program with an innovative Multi Award Contract (MAC) in place that has consistently proven capable of delivering on or ahead of schedule. Additionally, the program uses a robust Continuous Process Improvement (CPI) program to improve the delivery speed and quality of network capabilities to the Fleet.

Justification.val:
The FY21 decrease in the Consolidated Afloat Networks and Enterprise Services (CANES) funding profile aligns CANES with available ship modernization windows and the program's capacity to procure and install the product. This ensures CANES is deployed to the Fleet as quickly as possible to mitigate cyber security threats, keep pace with increased computing requirements for hosted applications, and support Department of Defense (DoD) directives to remove End of Life (EOL) Windows Operating Systems software from the Fleet as quickly as feasible. Obsolete Commercial Off-The-Shelf (COTS) legacy hardware and the termination of cyber security support for legacy versions of COTS software products (Microsoft, RedHat, Linux) drive increased sustainment costs, reduce operational availability and create critical cyber security vulnerabilities in Navy Tactical Networks. Replacing these legacy networks and modernizing the tactical environment with CANES is the cornerstone for all Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (C4ISR) investments.

CANES receives additional funds in FY21 to begin adding Military Sealift Command (MSC) ships to the program's Target Inventory Objective (TIO).

FY 2021 - CANES funds are for the procurement of (20) Afloat production units (0 Force Level, 11 Unit Level, 6 Subs, 3 MSC) and (13) Technical Insertion units (3 Force Level, 6 Unit Level, 4 Subs), with integration and associated costs for pre-installation design and the installation of (18) Afloat production units and (18) Technical Insertion units. CANES funds will also be used for the procurement of (1) MSC First Article and the installation of (5) Ashore units.
It is important to note that procurement quantities across the Future Year Defense Program (FYDP) are the same CANES end item products referenced in CANES LI 2925. Installation quantities represent sites receiving CANES are also referenced in LI 2925. The associated dollars in this exhibit represent the non-Intell investment in the CANES system.

Remarks.val: Consolidated Prior Year Requirements consists of: 1) CANES European Reassurance Initiative, 2) Operation Rolling Tide, and 3) Automated Digital Network System.

Model.val: Consolidated Afloat Networks & Enterprise Services (CANES) Non-MIP

Name.@footnote: The procurement average unit cost fluctuation is due to variance in system configuration requirements for each CANES platform type.  - A CANES unit level platform (DDG/CG/LSD) requires a smaller system, supporting fewer users and applications than force level platforms (CVN/LHD/LHA/LCC) with a greater number of users and applications. For example, a CANES DDG design consists of 18 equipment racks and ~400 workstations, while a CANES CVN system consists of 51 equipment racks and ~3000 workstations. The average procurement cost (hardware, software, integration, and engineering support) for a unit level ship ranges from $5.2M to $7.5M, while the average procurement cost for a force level platform ranges from $11.8M to $15.6M, and submarine unit procurement costs range from $2.7M to $4.6M. These costs include both the MIP and non-MIP components of the CANES units.     - CANES Afloat installations are performed at several fleet concentration areas supported by six installation Multiple Award Contract (MAC) holders. The Naval Information Warfare Command (NAVWAR) Fleet Readiness Directorate (FRD) Installation Organization (FIO) has ensured sufficient Alteration Installation Teams (AIT) resources are available to meet the FY21 - 25 CANES installation plan.        - CANES Afloat production units require an additional 5 months after delivery for integration, assembly and testing prior to installation start.  Installations do not begin until 11 months after contract award (6 months production lead time (PLT) + 5 months integration). Total lead time, including admin lead time, is 12 months.         - Installation cost fluctuations are attributed to and dependent on ship location, class, and variant of predecessor system the hull currently has installed. As an example of variant differences, if a CVN has an ISNS Delta variant installed, a CANES installation is estimated to be $18.2M. If that same CVN had a legacy Asynchronous Transfer Mode Local Area Network (ATM LAN) the CANES installation is estimated to be $22.4M. This cost difference is driven by a number of issues such as the requirement for new or additional wiring, equipment, and configuration changes.

The decrease in Tech Insertion production unit cost from FY20 to FY21 is due to a lower percentage of more expensive Force Level units in FY21 compared to FY20.        - CANES technical insertion installations are conducted across several fleet concentration areas supported by six installation Multiple Award Contract (MAC) holders. The NAVWAR Fleet Readiness Directorate (FRD) Installation Organization (FIO) has ensured sufficient Alteration Installation Teams (AIT) resources are available to meet the FY20 - 24 CANES installation plan.        - CANES Afloat technical insertion units require an additional 5 months after delivery for operational integration, assembly and testing prior to installation start.  Installations do not begin until 11 months after contract award (6 months production lead time (PLT) + 5 months integration). Total lead time, including admin lead time, is 12 months.

Name.val: 1.1.3) CANES - Service Life Extension Program (SLEP) (Non-MIP) - NonOrganic

Name.@footnote: First Article Procurement added in FY21 to support addition of Maritime Sealift Command (MSC) platforms to CANES Target Inventory Objective.  CANES first articles are defined as necessary production design drawings, environmental (shock and vibration) qualifications, logistics and training artifacts as well as a certified tested baseline provided to the government for each platform first of its kind. CANES First Articles are not installed.

CANES: Full Production Contract has 7 possible vendors on MAC award: Northrop Grumman Systems Corp, BAE Sytems Technology Solutions & Services, General Dynamics C4 Systems, Global Technical Systems, SERCO, Inc, CGI Federal Inc, DRS Laurel Technologies. Contract will be used for both production and tech refresh units

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: CANES - Afloat Technical Insertion (Non-MIP)
[none specified]:: Installation Name: CANES - Service Life Extension Program (SLEP) (Non-MIP)
CANES - Afloat First Articles (Non-MIP) - Not Installed

Description.val: The consolidation of existing Afloat Network programs of record designed to provide an agile, responsive Common Computing Environment (CCE) and Agile Core Services (ACS) within and upon which application developers will host Command and Control, Warfare, Intelligence, Logistics, and business and education applications and services. Migration of Non-Classified Enclave (NCE) capabilities into the CANES baseline. CANES is a mature program required to mitigate heightened cyber security threats across Navy tactical networks.

Model.val: Consolidated Afloat Networks & Enterprise Services (CANES) Non-MIP

Name.@footnote: Prior to FY19, all Ashore units consisted of TTE procurements and installations, which do not require DSA, all Ashore units procured in FY20 are MOC units, which require DSA.

Ashore procurement quantities are detailed as follows: Technical Training Equipment (TTE) - PY (3) Maritime Operation Center (MOC)(including Aegis Ashore) - PY (0); FY19 (3), FY20 (5).        -A MOC is a fully operational system configuration. A TTE configuration is a subset of a MOC configuration. This scale difference accounts for the fluctuation in per unit costs across fiscal years commensurate with the procurement quantities outlined in above note.        -TTE has no associated DSA requirements.    -Production Lead Time is 6 months for Ashore units. Total Ashore lead time, including 1 month Admin lead time and 5 months for integration, assembly and testing, is 12 months.

First Articles are defined as necessary production design drawings, environmental (shock and vibration) qualifications, logistics and training artifacts as well as a certified tested baseline provided to the government for each platform first of its kind. CANES First Articles are not installed.

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: CANES - Ashore - Technical Insertion (Non-MIP)
CANES - Ashore First Articles (Non-MIP) - Not Installed

Description.val: The consolidation of existing Ashore Network programs of record designed to provide a single, agile, responsive Common Computing Environment (CCE) hardware and software suite which will host Command and Control, Warfare, Intelligence, Logistics, Business, and Education/Training applications and services for Maritime Operation Centers (MOC), Aegis Ashore (AA), and Technical Training Equipment (TTE) sites. CANES will provide complete Local Area Network (LAN) infrastructure and services inclusive of hardware, software, processing, storage, workstations, and tablets for all basic network services (email, web, chat, collaboration) at these sites.
